intro: Hieracium dollineri subsp. subcrinitellum, commonly known as the Dolnířová hawkweed, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the Czech Republic. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has finely divided leaves and produces small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
